column4: I forgot both my username and password for Ubuntu. What should I do? Booting in recovery mode simply asks for a password too.
Can someone help me figure out my Ubuntu username and/or reset it and my password?
boot to a livecd (the ubuntu livecd is just fine), mount the partition, 'sudo chroot /path/to/partition', and then do 'passwd <youruser>'
I'm not sure what the partiion is called. Is there a way to figure it out? it's a SATA drive.
you can start gparted (maybe you'll need to install it in the livecd: 'sudo apt-get install gparted' in the console) and see which partition is the one you use
you can also do 'echo /dev/hd* /dev/sd*', and that will give you another list (though less comprensible)
I have a ton of them. It says /dev/sda /dev/sda1 /dev/sda2 /dev/sdb /dev/sdb2 /dev/sdb5 /dev/sdb6 and many others.
create a directory: 'sudo mkdir /mnt/linux'; then 'sudo mount /dev/sdXX /mnt/linux'
Thanks. I mounted that and found my username in the /etc/passwd file. now, how do I reset it?
Even though the username I entered is in the passwd file.
mm... I am not sure then... did you do it from within the chroot?
No, how do I do that?
'sudo chroot /mnt/linux' (replace /mnt/linux if you mounted it in another dir)
I was able to reset the password. Now rebooting and testing. Thanks!
